name: Skeleton Words 18 Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: LCST (An insect of warm and tropical regions which travels in vast swarms stripping large areas of vegetation)
GNN (Original, real or authentic)
RDCLS (Absurd, preposterous or laughable)
RS (The continents of Europe and Asia considered as a whole)
XCLBR (The magic sword of King Arthur)
MRTYR (A person who suffers greatly or dies for a cause or belief)
RZN (The American state containing the 'Petrified Forest' with petrified coniferous trees about 170,000,000 years old)
NN (Colourless, odourless and rare gaseous element)
CM (A small character part played by a distinguished actor)
DC (A playing card or dice with two pips or spots)
SCNR (A summary of the plot of a play)
GHSTWRT (To write an autobiographical or other article on behalf of a person who is then credited as author)
FLTTRBRD (An American or Canadian word for an oblong board or piece of polystyrene plastic used by swimmers in training or practice. We Brits. call it a float)
TCTR (Used at the end of a list to indicate that other items of the same class should be considered or included)
GLN (Rudolph ... mayor of New York City 1994-2001)
FGG (A city in south-east Italy)
TSRVTCH (A son of a Russian tsar especially the eldest son)
MNSTR (A province of the Republic of Ireland consisting of the counties of Clare, Cork, Kerry, Limerick, Tipperary and Waterford)
NF (The earth's core thought to be composed of nickel (Ni) and iron (Fe))
PTRLGY (The study of the composition, origin, structure and formation of rocks)
TSNM (A large destructive sea wave produced by a submarine, earthquake, subsidence or volcanic eruption)
RP (A satellite of Jupiter)
PRTRS (Andries ...  a Boer leader in the Great Trek (1838) who the city of Pretoria was named after)
VLCN ( ...  Islands are a group of three volcanic islands in the west Pacific 700 miles south of Japan. The largest being Iwo Jima taken by US forces in 1945)
questions.explanation:
Volcano.

	Iwo Jima was formerly called Sulphur Island and the largest of the Japanese Volcano Islands. A photograph of the US flag being planted on its highest peak became a US symbol of the Pacific conflict.

questions.text: FRXNLL (An aromatic white-flowered Eurasian plant that emits a vapour capable of being ignited)
questions.explanation:
Fraxinella.

	This gas plant is also called dittany or burning bush. Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
